faqs.question: What is the role of The  Benefits Package and Tariffs Advisory Panel
faqs.answer:
The Social Health Insurance (General) Regulations, 2024 Section (41), (42), (43) provides for review of the benefits package every two years through the establishment of the Benefits Package and Tariffs Advisory Panel (BPTAP).


The Benefits Package and Tariffs Advisory Panel is required to update the package every two years, based on evidence-based research, transparency, consultation and inclusivity as outlined in the regulations.

faqs.question: Why is BPTAP hosted at the University of Nairobi?
faqs.answer:
Section (44) of the Social Health Insurance (General) regulations, 2024 outlines the need for this process to be based on research, transparent, consultative and inclusive thus the use of Health Technology Assessment (HTA) as a key component for informing coverage decisions, particularly in defining the essential health benefits package that the Social Health Authority covers under Primary Healthcare (PHC) Fund, Social Health Insurance Fund (SHIF) and the Emergency, Critical illness and Chronic Illness Fund.


Institutionalization of the Health Technology Assessment process in Kenya is therefore anchored in a local public university, required to play a critical role in the Health Technology Assessment (HTA) process by contributing academic and technical expertise that underpins high-quality, evidence-informed decision making.
